Uses of Package
org.protune.net

Packages that use org.protune.net
org.protune.core Package org.protune.core provides the core classes of the Protune system. 
org.protune.net Key concepts Package org.protune.net provides a number of classes taking care of the issues related with the communication among nodes of a network. 
 

Classes in org.protune.net used by org.protune.core
Message
          In order to grant that communication among nodes actually takes place, it is required that each node is able to understand the information it receives, which means that the nodes need to share the same information representation.
NegotiationMessage
          Interface NegotiationMessage represents a generic message exchanged between two Peers during a negotiation.
OngoingNegotiationMessage
          In the Protune system we are mostly interested in negotiations among (pairs of) peers.
Service
          A Service object represents a service provided on some node of the network, whose result should be sent back to the client asking for it.
WrongMessageTypeException
          Exception to be sent when some entity during a negotiation realises that the message it is working on does not belong to the expected type.
 

Classes in org.protune.net used by org.protune.net
AddressPortPointer
          Simple implementation of the Pointer interface, suitable for the cases in which a pair (address, port) as itself identifies an instance of a service.
DispatcherStartNegotiationMessage
          Classes ServiceRequestMessage, ServiceAvailableMessage, ServiceNotAvailableMessage and DispatcherStartNegotiationMessage were developed in order to support negotiations with a DispatcherPeer.
EndNegotiationMessage
          In the Protune system we are mostly interested in negotiations among (pairs of) peers.
Message
          In order to grant that communication among nodes actually takes place, it is required that each node is able to understand the information it receives, which means that the nodes need to share the same information representation.
NegotiationMessage
          Interface NegotiationMessage represents a generic message exchanged between two Peers during a negotiation.
NegotiationResult
          Interface NegotiationResult represents the generic result of a negotiation.
OngoingNegotiationMessage
          In the Protune system we are mostly interested in negotiations among (pairs of) peers.
Peer
          The interface Peer represents a generic node of a Peer to Peer network.
Pointer
          In order to grant that communication among nodes actually takes place, it is required that the information sent by one node is received by the other one, which means that each node needs to have a reference (pointer) to the location of the other one.
Service
          A Service object represents a service provided on some node of the network, whose result should be sent back to the client asking for it.
ServiceRequestMessage
          Classes ServiceRequestMessage, ServiceAvailableMessage, ServiceNotAvailableMessage and DispatcherStartNegotiationMessage were developed in order to support negotiations with a DispatcherPeer.
StartNegotiationMessage
          In the Protune system we are mostly interested in negotiations among (pairs of) peers.
WrongMessageTypeException
          Exception to be sent when some entity during a negotiation realises that the message it is working on does not belong to the expected type.
